title: üèïÔ∏è Shelter Setup (Days 1-3)
goal: Provide safe, weather-resistant, and comfortable sleeping and storage areas for Phase 1, while keeping options flexible for future expansion.

materials.name: Tent pegs and guy ropes (heavy duty)

steps.title: Prepare Shelter Area
steps.description: Select level ground at least 10m from the container and water sources. Clear rocks, sticks, and vegetation. Slightly slope the area for drainage.

steps.title: Clean & Organize Container
steps.description: Sweep out debris. Inspect for rust, holes, and damage. Apply rust converter if needed. Install louver vents near roof level on opposite sides for ventilation.

steps.title: Create Storage Zones
steps.description: Left side: tools and hardware. Center: emergency supplies and water. Right side: food storage. Use shelving units where possible. Leave 2m x 3m emergency sleeping space clear.

steps.title: Construct Tent Platforms
steps.description: Use pallets to build raised floors. Level each pallet with stones or blocks. Cover with plywood sheets for smoother surface and insulation.

steps.title: Erect Canvas Tents
steps.description: Follow manufacturer instructions. Secure guy ropes tightly. Angle tents to allow proper wind flow. Attach additional tarpaulin over tents with 200mm air gap for rain protection.

steps.title: Install Shade Structures
steps.description: Erect poles 3m high on north and west sides. Attach shade netting to reduce direct sun by ~40%. Ensure poles are stable in strong winds.

steps.title: Set up Lighting & Safety
steps.description: Install battery LED lights inside tents and container. Keep a fire extinguisher in container. Maintain clear pathways between tents and water/sanitation points.

steps.title: Inspection & Adjustment
steps.description: Check all guy ropes, tarps, and pallets for stability. Test tents against wind by shaking lightly. Ensure shade nets do not sag or tear.

tips.content: üí° Place tents slightly elevated to prevent flooding during heavy rain.
üí° Keep container doors unlocked during daytime for ventilation, but lock at night for security.
üí° Rotate mattress and bedding weekly to prevent dampness and mold.
üí° Consider reflective tarpaulin over tents in summer to reduce heat inside.

safety: Always wear gloves when handling pallets and metal shelving.
Secure ladders before climbing to mount vents or shade structures.
Check weather forecast before erecting tents to avoid high wind accidents.
Keep fire sources away from tents and dry tarpaulins.
